So based on @junrao's comment it seems like the cleanShutdown file serves a purpose beyond the documented upgrade path and I don't see a super reasonable alternative - would it maybe just make sense to switch the current TODO remove cleanShutdownFile into an explanation of what its used for and keep the cleanShutdownFile?

@yussufsh which power support you were referring to? http://rocksdb.org/blog/

cc @enothereska
I noticed a unit test failure with message `pure virtual method called` which has traditionally come from RocksDB.

Also when running locally on my laptop I got:  `Assertion failed: (is_last_reference), function ~ColumnFamilyData, file db/column_family.cc, line 458.` for one of the tests. Haven't dug deeper but I noticed this was a problem with 5.4.5 too (see https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/3472).

I have a doubt in the example provided for the `outerJoin` in the java-doc,  Could you please explain,

how the result of the `K2:ValueJoiner(null, b)` came if `<K2:B>` and `<K2:b>` belong to the correct windows ?

@mimaison : I dropped the ball of finishing the review. I will make another pass in the next few days.
@lindong28 : I started looking at your latest patch. I will finish my review today.
I've rebased it just yesterday. passes tests both locally and on the build server.
@junrao : Thanks much for your time! I also reviewed the entire patch again and found 3 minor issues. I will address all of them after your review.

> @guozhangwang @bbejeck What about my comment with regard to exception handling?

That is resolved in the latest commit, no? https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/3461/files/1ee94cb7f104f1cbfa49a74d30a2dbdfcc82875d#diff-b4b7f559587d730df01edab3cb49dfa7
@mjsax yeah let's do that just in case there are some "illegal" client ids in the system tests.
ping @hachikuji

We will process one record after the other. Thus, in this example we assume that `<K2:b>` is processed first. Thus, `<K2:B>` is not there yet and we get `ValueJoiner(null, b)`. Afterwards, `<K2,B>` is processed and it will join with `<K2:b>`. The point is, that we don't delay the processing of any records. The result could also be `ValueJoiner(B, null)` + `ValueJoiner(B,b)` if `<K2,B>` is processed before `<K2:b>`

Does this make sense?
This test failure happened multiple times this week. @guozhangwang is looking into it already (it's reproducible locally)
Retest this please.
Test triggered: https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/972/
Yes, it is. Thanks for the explanation.
@fhussonnois Can you rebase this PR so we can review it? Thanks!

cc @hachikuji
Just checking, is this ready for review?
cc @junrao
@junrao, this approach means an additional file handle per segment. Do you think this is the way to go or the alternative option described in the JIRA?
Can we move the changes to `getPartitionAssignmentForTopics` and `getConsumersPerTopic` to a separate PR?
To be honest, I am not clear of the benefit of moving some of the functionality to the companion object. It may not be worth it.
@ijuma Thanks for the feedback. The reference was updated in the new commit.
@ijuma I just added an example of before and after failure traces in the PR description.

Thanks. Hmm, wouldn't it be more useful to have the stacktrace for `GroupAuthorizationException`? We could do that by enabling stacktraces by default and disabling them only for the exceptions stored in `Errors`.

Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

@ijuma Do you mean having something like this with the example above:
```
org.apache.kafka.common.errors.GroupAuthorizationException: Not authorized to access group: test-group
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator$GroupCoordinatorResponseHandler.onSuccess(AbstractCoordinator.java:608)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator$GroupCoordinatorResponseHandler.onSuccess(AbstractCoordinator.java:1)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.RequestFuture$1.onSuccess(RequestFuture.java:205)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.RequestFuture.fireSuccess(RequestFuture.java:168)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.RequestFuture.complete(RequestFuture.java:128)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.ConsumerNetworkClient$RequestFutureCompletionHandler.fireCompletion(ConsumerNetworkClient.java:488)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.ConsumerNetworkClient.firePendingCompletedRequests(ConsumerNetworkClient.java:348)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.ConsumerNetworkClient.poll(ConsumerNetworkClient.java:262)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.ConsumerNetworkClient.poll(ConsumerNetworkClient.java:208)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.ConsumerNetworkClient.poll(ConsumerNetworkClient.java:184)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator.ensureCoordinatorReady(AbstractCoordinator.java:215)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator.ensureCoordinatorReady(AbstractCoordinator.java:201)
	.
        .
        .
	Suppressed: org.apache.kafka.common.KafkaException: An error occurred in the broker when looking up the group coordinator.
		at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator.ensureCoordinatorReady(AbstractCoordinator.java:226)
		.
                .
                .
```

or not have the suppressed stack trace at all?

@guozhangwang From version 5.3.6 onwards , rocksdb has IBM PowerPC64 Little-Endian support (PPC64LE). https://github.com/facebook/rocksdb/releases/tag/v5.3.6
glibc compatibility issues are there but that is rectified in the newer versions 5.4.7 & 5.5.1
@junrao Please review this PR. Thanks.
